page.title: 20RIVERSIDE GRAVESEND
page.content: The{Fort Gardens}are on the site of various forts, dating back to Tudor times. Much work is being done to renovate the tunnels and underground {Magazines}as a tourist attraction. The gardens are set out as a pleasure park with trees, flowerbeds, benches, ponds and a{Bandstand}.A number of cannon from different periods are on display. {The Chantry}is a very old monument, used originally as a church and later as{Barracks}in the fort.{English {Heritage}are hoping to stage different exhibitions. The{Gordon Promenade}runs from the gardens to the Canal Basin. It has been renovated and offers pleasant surroundings whilst looking at the{River.}As you walk along the river you come to the lock leading to the{Canal Basin,}now used as a harbour for small craft. Access to the{Thames is at high tide only.
